newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian shares fall but local support seen.
newsitem.headline: Russian shares fall but local support seen.

text.p: Prices of leading Russian shares fell on Friday as Western investors declined to buy but traders said domestic investors would provide support next week.
The Russian Trading System 24-share index fell 4.4 percent to 331.82 from 347.20 on a total market volume of $39.7 million.
Domestic buyers boosted prices at midday after a fall on news that the Russian parliament had called for limits on foreign investment.
Power utilities, targeted by the Duma in a first reading of a bill, were especially hit by the news, traders said.
"The news from the Duma sparked a sell-off of utilities UES, Mosenergo and in particular Irkutskenergo," said Andrei Kukk, head of share operations at Rinako Plus.
UES fell to $0.2375 from $0.2405, Mosenergo dropped to $1.450 from $1.537 and Irkutsk fell to $0.252 from $0.269.
But traders said domestic market players would prevent a strong correction next week, even if Western support was lacking.
"Maybe the market will not grow without Western support, but there will not be any catastrophic fall," Kukk said.
Oleg Martynenko, head of equity trading at Rossiisky Kredit said domestic players could show strong support.
"Russian resources flowing from GKOs (discount Treasury Bills) are more mobile and will support the market," he said.
The worst performers on the RTS were Moscow City Telephone (MGTS) which fell to $1.30 from $1.60 at Thursday's close and AO Sakhalinmorneftegaz which fell to $2.90 from $3.40.
Lenenergo preferred shares fell to $0.595 from $0.680.
Traders said the market showed high volatility due to growing internal speculation.
